Question: Which of the following is the most appropriate description of polymorphism in object-oriented design?

Choices.a: It allows developers to define classes incrementally by reusing classes defined previously as the basis for new classes.
Choices.b: It allows a class to focus on the important dimensions while ignoring nonessential dimensions.
Choices.c: It combines processes and data into a single object.
Choices.d: It is the provision of a single interface to entities of different types.

Question: Which of the following is obtained only when the integer value of integer x is 25 ≤ x ≤ 55?
Which of the following is an appropriate testing type to ensure that the interfaces and linkages between different parts of programs work properly?
Which of the following is an explanation of the reverse engineering of software?

Choices.a: The internal structure and content of the existing software is analyzed and understood.
Choices.b: The software is redesigned and tested.
Choices.c: The internal structure and content are changed without any change to the externally observable behavior.
Choices.d: The code used is automatically generated from the design information by a development support tool.
